item.title: Whole Milk for Healthy Kids Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 293.

item.title: Ensuring Accountability in Agency Rulemaking Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 215 - 207 (Roll no. 711). (text: CR H6828-6829)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 215 - 207 (Roll no. 711). (text: CR H6828-6829)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216 - 205 (Roll no. 710). (consideration: CR H6832-6833)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6832-6833)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 922, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Scanlon demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 922.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6828-6832)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 53.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 1147 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate and H.R. 357 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on both measures. It also provides that on any legislative day of the second session of the 118th Congress before January 9, 2024, the Speaker may dispense with organizational and legislative business and that the Journal of the proceedings of the previous day shall be considered as approved if applicable.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-308, by Mrs. Fischbach.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-308, by Mrs. Fischbach.

cdata.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1147) to amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to allow schools that participate in the school lunch program under such Act to serve whole milk; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 357) to require the head of an agency to issue and sign any rule issued by that agency, and for other purposes.

This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1147) to amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to allow schools that participate in the school lunch program under such act to serve whole milk. It further provides for consideration of the bill (H.R. 357) to require the head of an agency to issue and sign any rule issued by that agency, and for other purposes.

This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1147) to amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to allow schools that participate in the school lunch program under such act to serve whole milk.

It further provides for consideration of the bill (H.R. 357) to require the head of an agency to issue and sign any rule issued by that agency.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
